Module org.example.eiscuno
Package org.example.eiscuno.controller

Class GameUnoController

java.lang.Object
org.example.eiscuno.controller.GameUnoController
public class GameUnoController extends Object
Controller for the Uno game, handling the game logic and UI updates. This class manages the game state, player interactions, and visual updates.

    • COLOR_MAP

      private static final Map<String,String> COLOR_MAP
      A map to convert color names from Spanish to English. This is used for the color selection dialog when a player needs to choose a color.

  • Constructor Details

    • GameUnoController

      public GameUnoController()

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize()
      Initializes the game controller. This method is called when the FXML file is loaded. It sets up the game handler, registers the controller, and initializes the UI.

    • startThreads

      public void startThreads()
      Starts the threads that handle the game logic. This method initializes and starts the threads responsible for handling UNO callouts, playing the machine's turn, and checking for game over conditions.

    • initVariables

      private void initVariables()
      Initializes the variables for the game.

    • createNewGame

      private void createNewGame()
      Creates a new game instance. This method initializes a new GameHandler and sets the update visuals callback.

    • restoreCardVisuals

      private void restoreCardVisuals()
      Restores the visuals of the cards for both players and the table. This method is called when loading a saved game to ensure that all card visuals are correctly displayed.

    • updateVisuals

      public void updateVisuals()
      Updates the visuals of the game, including player cards and the current color. This method is called to refresh the UI after any game state change.

    • printHumanPlayerCards

      public void printHumanPlayerCards()
      Prints the human player's cards on the grid pane. This method retrieves the visible cards for the human player and displays them in the UI.

    • printMachinePlayerCards

      private void printMachinePlayerCards()
      Prints the machine player's cards on the grid pane.

    • updateCurrentColorUI

      private void updateCurrentColorUI()
      Updates the UI to reflect the current color of the card on the table. This method retrieves the color of the current card and updates the label accordingly.

    • attachClickHandlerToCard

      private void attachClickHandlerToCard(Card card, javafx.scene.image.ImageView cardImageView)
      Attaches a click handler to the card image view. This method allows the player to click on a card to play it, and updates the table image view accordingly.
      Parameters:
      card - the card to attach the click handler to
      cardImageView - the ImageView representing the card

    • showColorDialog

      private String showColorDialog()
      Shows a color selection dialog to the user. This method allows the user to choose a color when playing a wild card.
      Returns:
      the selected color as a string

    • shutdownApplication

      public void shutdownApplication()
      Shuts down the application gracefully. This method stops all running threads and exits the application.

    • onHandleTakeCard

      void onHandleTakeCard(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent event)
      Handles the action when the player clicks on the "Take Card" button. This method checks if it's the player's turn and if they have playable cards. If valid, it allows the player to take a card from the deck.
      Parameters:
      event - the mouse event triggered by clicking the button

    • onHandleUno

      void onHandleUno(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent event)
      Handles the action when the player clicks on the "UNO" button. This method checks if the player has only one card left and has not declared UNO yet. If valid, it declares UNO or calls out the machine for not declaring UNO.
      Parameters:
      event - the mouse event triggered by clicking the button

    • handleExit

      private void handleExit(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent event)
      Handles the action when the player clicks on the "Exit" button. This method shuts down the application gracefully.
      Parameters:
      event - the mouse event triggered by clicking the button

    • showTurnError

      private void showTurnError()
      Shows an error dialog when it's not the player's turn. This method is called when the player tries to play a card or take a card when it's not their turn.

    • showInvalidMoveError

      private void showInvalidMoveError()
      Shows an error dialog when the player tries to play an invalid move. This method is called when the player attempts to play a card that does not match the current card on the table.

    • showInvalidTryToTakeCardError

      private void showInvalidTryToTakeCardError()
      Shows an error dialog when the player tries to take a card while having playable cards. This method is called when the player attempts to take a card while they still have playable cards in hand.

    • onHandleBack

      void onHandleBack(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent event)
      Handles the "Back" button action to show the previous set of cards.
      Parameters:
      event - the action event

    • onHandleNext

      void onHandleNext(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent event)
      Handles the "Next" button action to show the next set of cards.
      Parameters:
      event - the action event
